article.headline: Here's what's coming to Hulu in September 2020, and what's leaving
article.body: Summer's almost over, and Hulu is coming back from its virtual programming slumber with a lineup of highly anticipated series in September 2020, including a returning fan favorite. That would be Season 2 of "Pen15" (Sept. 18), the hit original comedy from Maya Erskine and Anna Konkle, who play hilarious and cringe-inducing adolescent versions of themselves. The first season, which debuted way back in February 2019, was nominated for an Emmy for comedy writing. div.youtube { height:0; position:relative; padding-bottom:56.25%; } div.youtube > iframe { position: absolute; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; } Hulu will also launch another original comedy, "Woke" (Sept. 9), starring Lamorne Morris ("New Girl") as a Black cartoonist whose life is turned upside down after a run-in with racist cops. Also see: What's coming in September to: Netflix | Amazon Prime Video Meanwhile, a pair of FX favorites - "Fargo" (Sept. 28) and "Archer" (Sept. 16) - will return for new seasons, streaming on Hulu the day after airing on cable. The long-awaited fourth season of Noah Hawley's Emmy-winning crime anthology "Fargo" stars Chris Rock and Jason Schwartzman this time around, and will travel back to 1950 to tell a tale about Kansas City mobsters, while Season 11 of "Archer" has the animated superspy finally awakening from his coma and returning to work, such as it is. div.youtube { height:0; position:relative; padding-bottom:56.25%; } div.youtube > iframe { position: absolute; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; } The Walt Disney Co. DIS, +1.53%  -controlled streaming service also has the Emmy Awards (though a day late, on Sept. 21); next-day streaming of new episodes of Fox favorites like "Bob's Burgers," "Family Guy" and "The Simpsons" (all Sept. 28); the new FX docuseries "A Wildness of Error" (Sept. 26), about the notorious Jeffrey MacDonald murder case; and a ton of new movies, including the "Twilight" franchise (Sept. 1) and the Will Smith-vs.-CGI Will Smith thriller "Gemini Man" (Sept. 18). Here's what's on tap, as of Aug. 18 (release dates are subject to change):What's coming in September 2020 Sept. 1 Mike Tyson Mysteries: Complete Season 4 (Adult Swim) Jeopardy!: Episode Refresh (ABC) 50 First Dates (2004) Absolute Power (1997) Aeon Flux (2005) American Dragons (1998) An American Haunting (2006) Any Given Sunday (1999) Anywhere but Here (1999) Back to School (1986) Bad Girls from Mars (1991) The Bank Job (2008) Because I Said So (2007) The Birdcage (1997) Broken Lizard's Club Dread (2004) Call Me (1988) Carrington (1995) The Cold Light Of Day (2012) Cool Blue (1990) Criminal Law (1989) The Day the Earth Stood Still (2008) De-Lovely (2004) Demolition Man (1993) Desperate Hours (1990) Deuces Wild (2002) Employee of the Month (2006) The End of Violence (1997) Evil Dead II (1987) Extreme Justice (1993) The Festival (2019) Hanoi Hilton (1987) Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay (2008) Harold & Kumar Go To White Castle (2004) Hoosiers (1986) The House on Carroll Street (1988) I Feel Pretty (2018) The Impossible (2012) Invasion U.S.A.
